COMMENT_TX: $Opening Day - Judge Landis at game Overflow crowd ringed the outfield; largest opening day crowd here, and the second largest ever at Cubs Park.
Smith kicked on the 4th ball, which was called low
Friberg's high throw went into the Pirates' dugout; Pie's speed made Friberg hurry his throw on easy roller.
Alexander made him duck on 1-2 pitch, then put 3rd strike on outside corner.
Grantham drew a round of applause as he came to bat.  Crowd gasped when he poled hot liner down RF line, but just foul.
Fast fielding by Cuyler held Friberg at 2B
Spectacular catch robbed Grimm; earned a tremendous ovation
Bigbee had it stolen but overslid the bag
1-handed stop by Traynor; Grantham scooped low throw
Fast fielding by Statz held Cuyler to a single
Into CF crowd; Carey made a mighty effort for 1-handed catch
Caught at the fringe of the RCF crowd
Attempted double steal; big collision at the plate
$Into LF crowd; valiant effort by Bigbee

Tried to steal during windup; Smith took the low pitch and dove in front of the plate on his arm.  Great play. The infield had moved back.

Mgr McGraw again watched the game from the stands. Today was Golden Jubilee celebration for Cubs; flag raised. Many 'old-timers' at game including Deacon White who caught in the Cubs' first game at Louisville on April 25, 1876.  He is one of two survivors of Chicago's original lineup that year (1B man Cal McVey is the other, living in California). Tom Foley, who organized Chicago's first pro team in 1869, was also honored.  Judge Landis and Prez Heydler attended.
Wind carried it into RF bleachers
Pittenger cut in front of Freigau and both lost it
Into the remotest part of the LCF roofless veranda

Strong cold winds off Lake Michigan. Nearly half of NYT game summary referenced how cold it was. For example, 'There were no home runs in today's game.  A ball player cannot hit the ball very far when his teeth are chattering.' 'Wind blew into town from the Straits of Mackinac and shriveled up the flowers in the park and brought all the winter coats out of the camphor closets.'
NYT: Hit on left elbow; CDT: 'Hit on the pants or somewhere'
Over Brooks who was bothered by the high wind
Youngs lost the short fly in the sun/wind but got the force

Low liner that Kelly caught close to his shoe strings. Cubs argued with Ump Wilson that Kelly had trapped it. Jackson had an easy triple play before him but threw into the Giants' dugout when nobody covered 1B.

$BOUNCE HR CDT: 'With the help of the strong Oklahoma wind, the ball went over Brooks so deep in CF that it bounced over the high screen for a homer.  It takes a lively ball to bounce that high on a sod field, but this one was lively.' Brooks was playing deep but seemed to misjudge it just enough to let it get over him.
